contentrichtext.text: {{For|the river Tom in the Amur basin|Tom River (Amur Oblast)}} {{Geobox|River <!-- *** Heading *** --> |name =Tom |native_name = Томь |ther_name = Tomi | category = <!-- *** Names **** --> |etymology = |nickname = <!-- *** Image *** --> |image = Железнодорожный мост через р.Томь.jpg |image_caption = Tom near Novokuznetsk |image_size = 300px <!-- *** Country *** --> |country = Russia |country_flag = 1 |region = |region1 = [[Tomsk Oblast]] |region2 = [[Kemerovo Oblast]] |region3 = [[Khakassia]] |district = |municipality = <!-- *** Family *** --> |parent = |tributary_left = Aba River |tributary_left1 = Condom River |tributary_left2 = Mras-Su River |tributary_left3 = Unga River |tributary_left4 = Iskitimka River |tributary_right = Belsu River |tributary_right1 = Taydon River |tributary_right2 = Nizhnaya Ters River |tributary_right3 = Srednaya Ters River |tributary_right4 = Verchnaya Ters River |tributary_right5 = Usa River |tributary_right6 = Basandayka River |tributary_right7 = [[Ushayka River|Ushayka]] River |city = [[Seversk]] |city1 = [[Tomsk]] |city2 = [[Yurga]] |city3 = [[Kemerovo]] |city4 = [[Novokuznetsk]] |city5 = [[Mezhdurechensk]] |landmark = <!-- *** River locations *** --> |source = Levaya Tom River |source location = Abakan range | source_region = Khakassia |source1 = Pravaya Tom River |source1_location = Abakan range | source_region = Khakassia |mouth = [[Ob River]] |mouth_location = Ob River| mouth_region = Tomsk Oblast <!-- *** Dimensions *** --> |length = 827 |width = |depth = |volume = |watershed = 62030 <!-- *** Free fields *** --> |free = | free_type = <!-- *** Maps *** --> |map = Tom river.png |map_caption = Map of the Tom River watershed <!-- *** Footnotes *** --> |footnotes = }} '''Tom''' ({{lang-rus|Томь|p=tomʲ}}, {{lang-cjs|Том}}) is a river in [[Russia]], a right [[tributary]] of the [[Ob River|Ob]]. Its length is 540 miles (871 km). Its source is in the [[Abakan mountains]] (a northern continuation of the [[Altay Mountains]]), and it flows northward through the [[Kuznetsk Basin]]. It flows into the Ob approximately 30 miles (50 km) north of [[Tomsk]]. Cities on the Tom River include [[Mezhdurechensk, Kemerovo Oblast|Mezhdurechensk]], [[Novokuznetsk]], [[Kemerovo]], [[Yurga]], [[Tomsk]], and [[Seversk]].
